FuncDef:
The data-packet priority command configures a priority for DCN packets.
The undo data-packet priority command restores the default value.
By default, the priority of DCN packets is 3.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority of DCN packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 5. A larger value indicates a higher priority.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Network packets have different priorities, and high-priority packets will be transmitted first. Run the
data-packet priority command to configure a priority for DCN packets based on the service traffic situation of the network.
If the priorities of other packets are higher than the priority of DCN packets, decrease the DCN packet priority to prevent packet loss.If the priorities of other packets are lower than the priority of DCN packets, increase the DCN packet priority to facilitate the communications between NEs or between NEs and NMSs.

Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The data-packet priority command cannot be used to configure a priority for link-layer or OSPF protocol packets because their priority is the highest by default.
